Tipperary worked with their local authority to install 3 CCTV cameras in their village in response to an increased number of thefts and burglaries in their area.::Due to data management legislation, the local Gardai are unable to monitor the CCTV footage, as the local authority originally arranged the installation of the CCTV cameras. Specific Details: The subject matter was the upcoming ComReg multi-band spectrum auction, and how it should proceed.
DPOs Lobbied: Sean Canney|Minister of State|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications::Richard Bruton|Minister|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications::Mark Griffin|Secretary General|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications::Ciarán Ó hÓbáin|Assistant Secretary|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications
Subject Matter: The subject matter was the upcoming ComReg multi-band spectrum auction, and how it should proceed.
Intended Results: Three Ireland was seeking to communicate its views on how the multi-band spectrum auction would proceed. Three commissioned economic consultants NERA to identify key issues that should be addressed by ComReg in the auction and issue recommendations.::Three does not believe that the price for spectrum should be inflated above market value. The rules on packaging and caps should be as simple as possible to achieve an efficient outcome. Three Ireland believes that the 2100MHz band should not form part of this upcoming auction and should be part of a separate allocation. Three also believes that ComReg should move the auction format away from Combinatorial Clock Auction format to a simpler format.
Lobbying Activities: Cover letter with NERA report enclosed sent to Sean Canney TD, Minister of State, Department of Communications, Climate Action & Environment|Submission|1::Cover letter with NERA report enclosed sent to Richard Bruton TD, Minister of Communications, Climate Action & Environment|Submission|1::Cover letter with NERA report enclosed sent to Mark Griffin, Secretary General, Department of Communications, Climate Action & Environment|Submission|1::Cover letter with NERA report enclosed sent to Ciaran O hObain, Assistant Secretary General, Department of Communications, Climate Action & Environment|Submission|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Joanna Kavanagh, Head of Corporate Affairs, Three Ireland
